intro: Aizoon subcarnosum, commonly known as the hairy leaf aizoon, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its stems are often branched and can grow up to several feet in height. Aizoon subcarnosum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
